oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Decca Records, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1962, Vol. 3 p. 43
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of Decca Records, located at 803 16th Avenue South. First established in Great Britain in 1929, the U.S. Decca label started in 1934. Decca's studio was established in 1955 by Owen Bradley, situated in Music Row. Decca Records was later absorbed by the Music Corporation of America in 1966, and the building is now leased as office space. Photographer unknown. Photograph used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1962. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
